content: [eyvind] Eyvind sighs in frustration when you agree to pack up and leave, slamming his fist against a wall. "Are you certain you'll not help me on the bridge? Listen, an entire race is about to be wiped out."
[eyvind] "Get me on that bridge," says Eyvind. "You know it's the only thing that makes sense."
[eyvind] "I know... they haven't been very cooperative." He looks you in the eyes. "But we can't take this lightly. Do we really abandon them to history?"

content.option: "We'll extend the offer, but we have to go."

content: [eyvind] There is silence between you for a long moment. "Alright," Eyvind finally says. "Get Iver and your caravan ready, I'll speak with Jorundr." Soon he returns, shaking his head. You know Jorundr refused any offer to flee.
[eyvind] "They did," mumbles Eyvind, crestfallen. "I've done everything I can. Gather Iver and the rest of your caravan, we'll leave for Sigrholm immediately."
[krumr] "I won't be coming with you," says Krumr. "They've put Fasolt in charge of the warriors here. He'll need help. Gods, we all will. Give Yngvar my regards." The giant returns to his warriors.
They send some varl with you, a few volunteers or those wounded on the bridge. You begin the long trek to Boersgard with a crippling ache in your heart.
